text: Few pay much heed to a man on the margins.
The Liao river has brought your lands both protection and prosperity. However, you are still considered an obscure and localized power by the scholars of the Han. You must strive for more.

Your administration has expanded, and your soldiers grow in numbers. No longer are you wallowing in the obscurity of being a lesser known regional power. Now, you are a warlord in your own right - with all the responsibilities and expectations which that brings.

You have become famed for safeguarding the security of the Han and expanding the borders of the Empire. Once desolate and isolated frontier towns are now bustling trade cities and centers of commerce. Scholars and refugees alike flock to your lands, seeking protection and opportunity. However, even as distant dignitaries praise your deeds and and name, few know of the amount of blood on your hands, and the pile of bones crushed under your feet.

From nothing, you have clawed your way up from the dirt to become the man of the hour.  There are few throughout the Empire who do not sing your praises, and your prestige and reputation are matchless and majestic. Rebels, bandits and barbarians alike quiver as they share stories of your prowess, and scurry away upon merely glimpsing your famed banners.
[[b]]Domestic Affair[[/b]] can be increased by battle against non-Han factions and buildings.
[[b]]Domestic Affair[[/b]] can be decreased by battle against Han factions and buildings.
• Two resource bars, Domestic Affair & Foreign Affairs both affect each other, you cannot have one maxed without the other being negative.
• Domestic Affair improves relations with Han factions and the Emperor, providing bonuses to Han units.
• Foreign Affairs improves relations with non-Han factions and providing their units for recruitment, providing bonuses to those units.
Chance for a non-Han Follower to be recruited
Chance for a Han Follower to be recruited
